to add custom information that you choose in each communication it makes with your web server. MarketplaceKit doesn’t require a specific authentication method for the installation of an alternative marketplace’s apps. You can use OAuth 2.0 or add custom information to associate the communication with the person signed in, or the person’s unique device. This effectively authorizes the system to act on the person’s behalf on subsequent calls to your web server for app licenses or alternative distribution packages.

content.text: Request installation from an alternative app marketplace

inlineContent.text: Your app requests app installation using MarketplaceKit API. The system enforces that installation requests source from a person’s interaction with your app’s UI. In other words, your app can install another app only when a person requests it by tapping a button. MarketplaceKit provides the
class for this purpose.
The following code defines an action button that presents the app install sheet for an app identified by the argument
. The code takes a
closure, and confirms the installation with an install verification token and authentication context.

To provide a responsive installation experience, give visual feedback while installation is in progress. Display your own custom UI according to the
object to provide visual feedback on the state of a given installation. Convey the progress in a way that works for your app; MarketplaceKit doesn’t provide a predetermined UI for progress.

abstract.text: Create an alternative app marketplace, distribute your app on an alternative app marketplace, or distribute your app from your website.
A user-interface element that enables a person to install, update, or launch apps by tapping the element.
An object that manages search characteristics, licensing, and the installation of apps.
The progress representing the download & installation of this app. It may be used to pause, resume, or cancel installation depending on the state of this object.
An identifier that represents an app.
An identifier that represents a single app version.
An extension that facilitates authentication, installation, and launching a marketplace with deep links.
Adds information to the request header for communications from the operating system to your marketplace endpoints.
Handles when iOS receives an unexpected response from your web server.
A URI scheme that defines an alternative distribution app installation link.
Process an available app version from App Store Connect and store it for download from your server.
Manage the installation of an app that you develop and distribute through your website.
